author: Andrew Tarantola
description: Our radio signals may be helping defend the Earth against space radiation.
title: Earth's radio signals may be protecting it from space radiation

description: Saturn’s largest moon resembles Earth with its rivers and mountains, but it came by its topography very differently - and could still be active today
title: Titan’s riverbeds show a terrain built more like Mars than Earth

author: Lewin Day
description: NASA spends a lot of time researching the Earth and its surrounding space environment. One particular feature of interest are the Van Allen belts, so much so that NASA built special probes...
title: Humans May Have Accidentally Created a Radiation Shield Around Earth

author: Gina Cherelus
description: The clowns, animal acts and acrobats of the storied Ringling Bros and Barnum & Bailey Circus are taking their final bow at an arena outside New York City on Sunday in the farewell performance of the "Greatest Show on Earth" after nearly 150 years.
title: 'Greatest Show on Earth' takes its final bow after 146 years

author: BBC News
description: Ladies and gentlemen, children  of all ages, say goodbye to the  ‘Greatest Show on Earth’.
title: The Circus Leaves Town - BBC News

author: Scott K. Johnson
description: Earth, Mars, and Titan all have channels, but different geologic pasts.
title: River channels on three worlds reveal a history of shifting landscapes

author: Greg Toppo
description: The final curtain falls late Sunday on the "Greatest Show on Earth."
title: Curtain falls on final Ringling Bros. circus performance

description: As I watched my friends shovelling earth on to Mum’s grave from my kitchen window, I knew I’d done the right thing.
title: 'I buried my mum in the back garden'

description: A single process for how a group of molecules called nucleotides were made on the early Earth, before life began, has been suggested by a UCL-led team of researchers.
title: How RNA formed at the origins of life

author: John von Radowitz
description: Professor Stephen Hawking has repeated his warning that human survival depends on finding a new home beyond the Earth. The search for other planets to colonise should start now, he believes. Speaking in London at a press conference previewing the Starmus science and arts festival taking place in Norway next month, the professor said: "I strongly believe we should start seeking alternative planets for possible habitation.
title: Stephen Hawking has a chilling message about the survival of humanity
